<title level="1" right="Deity " pfs="Standard">[Brigh (The Whisper In Bronze)](/Deities.aspx?ID=33)</title>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
</traits>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 56 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

Brigh’s exact origins are unknown, though her priests and various religious scholars have many theories on the matter. Some believe she was a construct who achieved consciousness and a spark of divinity, while others think she was a human alchemist and inventor who discovered ways to fuse mechanical components with her own physiology. Regardless of her origins, Brigh is a patient and thoughtful god who promotes unending curiosity and constant intellectual advancement. Her two most common forms are a humanoid woman made of bronze clockwork and a human woman wearing a bronze skullcap and armor composed of gears and other movable metal pieces. Though Brigh’s usual demeanor is composed and reserved, she isn’t an unfeeling automaton; she deeply cherishes the creations she and her followers make, and most of her worshippers feel the same way.

<column gap="tiny">

**Category** [Other Gods](/DeityCategories.aspx?ID=2)

**Edicts** craft new creations, pay attention to details, share achievements

**Anathema** carelessly destroy others’ creations or research, enslave intelligent constructs, abuse constructs, refuse to acknowledge or learn from mistakes

**Area of Concern**
clockwork, invention, and time

**Follower Alignments**
LN, NG, N, NE, CN

</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Deities/Brigh.png" />
</column>

</row>
<title level="2">Devotee Benefits</title>

<column gap="tiny">

**[Divine Ability](/Backgrounds.aspx?ID=132)**
Intelligence or Wisdom

**Divine Font** [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146) or [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148)

**Divine Skill** [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

**Favored Weapon** [Light Hammer](/Weapons.aspx?ID=29)

**Domains** [Creation](/Domains.aspx?ID=5), [Earth](/Domains.aspx?ID=10), [Knowledge](/Domains.aspx?ID=17), [Time](/Domains.aspx?ID=54)

**[Alternate Domains](/Rules.aspx?ID=802)** [Fire](/Domains.aspx?ID=13)

**Cleric Spells**

- **1st**
[Temporary Tool](/Spells.aspx?ID=590)

- **4th**
[Creation](/Spells.aspx?ID=54)

- **7th**
[Duplicate Foe](/Spells.aspx?ID=93)

</column><title level="2">Divine Intercession</title>

The Whisper in Bronze doesn’t dole out punishments or rewards to her followers lightly.

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic - Web Supplement](/Sources.aspx?ID=19) pg. 4</row>

<column gap="tiny">
**Minor Boon** Knowledge floods your mind. Once, you can reroll a failed skill check to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26); you must use the second result, even if it’s worse.

**Moderate Boon** You become a wellspring of invention. You gain the [Inventor](/Feats.aspx?ID=798) feat, even if you don’t meet its prerequisites, and when you roll a [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) check for the Inventor feat, you use the result one degree of success better than the result you rolled.

**Major Boon** You gain the companionship of a loyal construct ally of Brigh’s choice at least 1 level lower than you. If the construct is destroyed, it rebuilds itself over the course of a week, and as you gain levels, the construct upgrades and improves itself, becoming more powerful.
</column>

<column gap="tiny">
**Minor Curse** Your hands shake when attempting delicate work. All your failures to [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) or [Repair items](/Actions.aspx?ID=42) are instead critical failures.

**Moderate Curse** Whenever you try to perform engineering or science tasks, everything just seems to explode. Whenever you attempt to create or use an alchemical item or a construct, [Disable a Device](/Actions.aspx?ID=69), and so on, you must attempt a DC 15 flat check. On a failure, something explodes and you take 1d6 fire damage (or a different type of damage, if appropriate) per level of the item, construct, or device (DC 40 basic Reflex save).

**Major Curse** Constructs—even mindless constructs you thought you could control—seek your demise. All constructs are [hostile](/Conditions.aspx?ID=23) to you and attack you when they notice your presence. Occasionally, inanimate statues and other objects animate as constructs to pursue Brigh’s vengeance.
</column>
